references.paper_title: The rosetta all-atom energy function for macromolecular modeling and design
references.reason: This paper introduces the Rosetta energy function, a foundational tool for physics-based protein modeling and design, widely used in the field and providing a benchmark for newer AI-based methods.

references.paper_title: Robust deep learning-based protein sequence design using proteinmpnn
references.reason: This paper introduces ProteinMPNN, a state-of-the-art deep learning model for protein design, demonstrating the capabilities of AI for inverse protein folding and setting a benchmark for other methods.

references.paper_title: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with alphafold
references.reason: AlphaFold's groundbreaking accuracy in protein structure prediction has revolutionized the field, making it a critical resource for evaluating inverse protein folding models and providing high-quality ground truth data for training and testing.

references.paper_title: Generative models for graph-based protein design
references.reason: This is one of the earliest works to apply deep generative modeling to protein design using graph neural networks, setting the stage for many subsequent advancements in this area.

This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a powerful generative framework with wide-ranging applications, which has inspired many of the recent advances in inverse protein folding through diffusion models.
